head.title: National Briefing | New England: Maine: A Thumbs Up For Beer With Risque Labels

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | New England: Maine: A Thumbs Up For Beer With Risque Labels

abstract.p: Maine reverses its decision to bar beer distributor, Shelton Brothers, from selling three types of beer because its labels were deemed offensive (S)

block.p: The state reversed its decision to bar a Massachusetts beer distributor from selling three types of beer because its labels were deemed offensive. The Maine Bureau of Liquor Enforcement said the labels, two that feature bare-breasted women and one that shows Santa Claus from behind and sitting on a barrel, contained ''undignified or improper illustrations.'' The distributor, Shelton Brothers, filed a federal lawsuit against the state, which reversed its decision Dec. 20, said the owner, Will Shelton. He said he had not received a letter alerting him of the reversal until this week because he was in Germany.
